posts.post_content: Ponder was overpowered to say the least, the fact that this digs deeper and doesnt cantrip balances it out, though i really wish it was sleight of hand that they printed instead, at least the card got you one in hand to replace itself... never-the-less blue mages will use this despite how much worse it was in comparison to ponder or preordain, and at least it works alright with thought scour if you dont like what you see coming next... perhaps ravnica will yield better turn 1 spells for blue planeswalkers...

Posted By: Axelle (7/30/2012 10:11:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is good with [Augur of Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Augur of Bolas). [Ponder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ponder) wouldn't work with [Augur of Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Augur of Bolas). Play this, sort your topdeck for [Augur of Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Augur of Bolas) and cast AoB.  
  
So in the end, you kinda get [Ponder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ponder ) , and a 1/3 for 1UU. Con is no creatures or enchantments and -1 for card advantage.

Posted By: lorendorky (7/6/2012 1:57:25 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I believe this could pair well with [Thought Scour](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thought Scour) for library digging. Rearrange your top 5 so the two on top are your situational "trash". Toss [Thought Scour](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thought Scour) to mill the first two and pick up the third and leave the other two waiting for you next turns or cantrips. It digs you further than [Ponder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ponder), [Preordain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Preordain), and even [Brainstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brainstorm). Of course it requires you to have both cards but in a vacuum where you would be running both cards anyway why not? You still dug down essentially 3 cards but it puts you nearly 3 turns ahead as well. That can't often be said by some of the other options.  
  
EDIT: So I see a lot of people complaining. I like blue I really do. You can ask anyone I regularly play with. What I don't like is how uncompetitive it is by the shear fact that nothing can compete with it when you run things like Ponder and Brainstorm. Heaven forbid you have a little chance to the deck. ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I believe this could pair well with Thought Scour for library digging. Rearrange your top 5 so the two on top are your situational "trash". Toss Thought Scour to mill the first two and pick up the third and leave the other two waiting for you next turns or cantrips. It digs you further than Ponder, Preordain, and even Brainstorm. Of course it requires you to have both cards but in a vacuum where you would be running both cards anyway why not? You still dug down essentially 3 cards but it puts you nearly 3 turns ahead as well. That can't often be said by some of the other options.

EDIT: So I see a lot of people complaining. I like blue I really do. You can ask anyone I regularly play with. What I don't like is how uncompetitive it is by the shear fact that nothing can compete with it when you run things like Ponder and Brainstorm. Heaven forbid you have a little chance to the deck. ... posts.post_content: The fact that Ponder let you shuffle the crap away and cantrip pushed it over the edge. This card, even if Ponder hadn't existed, is bad. Planning ahead 5 turns is stupid, and almost never goes the way you want. The last 2 cards are basically useless.

posts.post_content:
I don't mind it missing the cantrip, I miss the part where you can shuffle your junk back into your deck if you pondered at junk. Heck I'd even be happy with   
"{U} sorcery: look at top 3 cards of your library. You may exile those cards. If you don't , then put them back on the top of your library in any order. "  
The fact that you are stuck with whatever you see makes me groan. I wouldn't play this card, not even in drafts.
